content: So, to start, could you tell me a bit about your experience with web development, maybe focusing on a project where you used HTML, CSS, and JavaScript? What was the biggest challenge you faced and how did you overcome it?
Got it. Can you elaborate on that project?
Okay, a landing page. Can you tell me about
Sure, tell me about the technologies you used. What were the key features you implemented using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript?
I use animated animations in the page using the animator scroll and
Cool. Can you describe how you implemented the scroll animations? What libraries or techniques did you use to achieve that effect?
I use a library and score library.
Okay, Bootstrap and Animate on Scroll. Can you tell me why you chose those specific libraries for this project? Were there any alternatives you considered?

Got it. So, you chose Animate on Scroll because it was compatible with plain HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and the other option was more specific to React. Now, thinking about the Animate on Scroll library, can you describe how it works internally? What does it do to detect when an element is in view and trigger the animation?
IT IS THE JAVA SCRIPT API TO CHECK THE ELEMEN IS IN VIEWPORT OR NOT
Okay, it uses a JavaScript API to check if the element is in the viewport. Which API is it using specifically, and how does that API determine if an element is visible?
